com.microsoft.azure.storage.blob

Class RequestRetryOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.microsoft.azure.storage.blob.RequestRetryOptions

  • public final class RequestRetryOptions
extends java.lang.Object
    Options for retrying requests

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static RequestRetryOptions DEFAULT
      An object representing default retry values: Exponential backoff, maxTries=4, tryTimeout=30, retryDelayInMs=4, maxRetryDelayInMs=120, secondayHost=null.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Configures how the HttpPipeline should retry requests.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT

        public static final RequestRetryOptions DEFAULT
        An object representing default retry values: Exponential backoff, maxTries=4, tryTimeout=30, retryDelayInMs=4, maxRetryDelayInMs=120, secondayHost=null.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RequestRetryOptions

        public RequestRetryOptions(RetryPolicyType retryPolicyType,
                           int maxTries,
                           int tryTimeout,
                           java.lang.Long retryDelayInMs,
                           java.lang.Long maxRetryDelayInMs,
                           java.lang.String secondaryHost)
        Configures how the HttpPipeline should retry requests.
        Parameters:
        retryPolicyType - A RetryPolicyType specifying the type of retry pattern to use.
        maxTries - Specifies the maximum number of attempts an operation will be tried before producing an error (0=default). A value of null means that you accept our default policy. A value of 1 means 1 try and no retries.
        tryTimeout - Indicates the maximum time allowed for any single try of an HTTP request. A value of null means that you accept our default timeout. NOTE: When transferring large amounts of data, the default TryTimeout will probably not be sufficient. You should override this value based on the bandwidth available to the host machine and proximity to the Storage service. A good starting point may be something like (60 seconds per MB of anticipated-payload-size).
        retryDelayInMs - Specifies the amount of delay to use before retrying an operation (0=default). The delay increases (exponentially or linearly) with each retry up to a maximum specified by MaxRetryDelay. If you specify 0, then you must also specify 0 for MaxRetryDelay.
        maxRetryDelayInMs - Specifies the maximum delay allowed before retrying an operation (0=default). If you specify 0, then you must also specify 0 for RetryDelay.
        secondaryHost - If a secondaryHost is specified, retries will be tried against this host. If secondaryHost is null (the default) then operations are not retried against another host. NOTE: Before setting this field, make sure you understand the issues around reading stale and potentially-inconsistent data at this webpage: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/common/storage-designing-ha-apps-with-ragrs

    • Method Detail

      • getMaxTries

        public int getMaxTries()
        Returns:
        MaxTries specifies the maximum number of attempts an operation will be tried before producing an error (0=default). A value of zero means that you accept our default policy. A value of 1 means 1 try and no retries.

      • getTryTimeout

        public int getTryTimeout()
        Returns:
        tryTimeout indicates the maximum time in seconds allowed for any single try of an HTTP request. A value of zero means that you accept our default timeout. NOTE: When transferring large amounts of data, the default TryTimeout will probably not be sufficient. You should override this value based on the bandwidth available to the host machine and proximity to the Storage service. A good starting point may be something like (60 seconds per MB of anticipated-payload-size).

      • getSecondaryHost

        public java.lang.String getSecondaryHost()
        Returns:
        If a secondaryHost is specified, retries will be tried against this host. If secondaryHost is null (the default) then operations are not retried against another host. NOTE: Before setting this field, make sure you understand the issues around reading stale and potentially-inconsistent data at this webpage: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/common/storage-designing-ha-apps-with-ragrs
